reviews.title: not very good
reviews.review_text: these work great. I used them in my storage building. I have three windows I wanted to cover. I like that they allow the curtains to curve around and come up against the wall, leaving no gaps for prying eyes. four stars because not all that long ago these were a dollar apiece.

reviews.title: Honestly
reviews.review_text: I was very happy with the quality of these curtain rods. They were constructed of a decent grade of metal and all edges were smooth and properly drilled I will order them again. And honestly the price was very affordable.

Got these to hang curtains in my RV. Not disappointed. Easy to install and hold up the curtains well. The longer size I ordered also had the hook to help hold up the middle and keep the rod level. Would purchase again. Would recomend.

reviews.title: Better Privacy and Insulation
reviews.review_text: Simple, easy to install. Best thing about them is they curve around sides of windows, providing more privacy and insulation. Will not show under pocket rod curtains.

The wall hooks were already in the wall so I'm glad the holes in the rod are standard size so all I had to buy was the rod. No other installation was necessary other than putting the curtains on the rods and hanging them up. Loved the price too!
used this to hang sheer curtains in bedroom. Easy set up ... did it by myself ... took 15 mins tops. Very sturdy ... no complaints so far!! Value for price was perfect!

The price really can't be beat but like most things you are trading a good price for a lesser quality item. The rod actually is somewhat flimsy and is easy to bend downward if someone pulls on the curtain. Yes I know, no one should be pulling on curtains but it happens.

reviews.title: Thin quality
reviews.review_text: They have two different types of curtain rods .. one actually do say heavy duty I prefer the. Heavy duty ones .. the regular ones tended to bend a thinner quality..

reviews.title: give him more chance to accept an item or decline
reviews.review_text: I wasn't given a chance to choose whether I wanted to accept the six curtain rods that I received instead I got six individual single mods and I ordered a six pack of six curtain rods I should have been given the option of rather to accept or decline it and I was not given that option so I am dissatisfied with this purchase of this item

reviews.title: Worst curtain rod I ever purchased
reviews.review_text: This was the most flimsy curtain rod I have ever purchased. I put sheer curtains on it (just one panel even) and didn't even get to finish putting curtains on the rod before it bent in half. It was so flimsy it felt like it was made of cardboard or something. Total rip off and waste of money. Purchased a different one and immediately after opening package of new one you could feel the difference and that it was thicker and stronger.

reviews.title: Save your money
reviews.review_text: I returned it because even with the “support” it bowed in the middle and couldn't even hold up a sheet I was using as a curtain in my boys room. Do not recommend. Gonna spend the $16 and get a decent curtain rod in stead of this flimsy garbage.

reviews.title: Sturdy and Functional
reviews.review_text: Worked as a cheap way to hang curtains and block doorways for the winter. Because it's a temporary installation I didn't want to spend a lot on rods. This is holding up well, that's with cats dangling and climbing the curtains, not bending or pulling out of the doorframe.

didn't have great expectations for the price but it worked for what I needed but I wish it had a support that screws into the wall for the middle. I've had others that come with one and they worked great. If this had a support for the middle I would give it 5 stars. Product came when expected and is decent for the price

I just needed something to hang blackout curtain the bottom of my kitchen for privacy. I didn't need anything fancy in the place is small so this will work out perfect I would not recommend it if you're planning on opening and closing at constantly I would probably invest in something a little better in a bit more sturdy

these are made to hold curtains. they hold curtains. unlike the curtains rods made to hold curtains that do not actually hold curtains, these are made to hold curtains and actually hold curtains. so I'm if youre looking for a Ferrari, this is not that. these are curtain rods

for the price, they were awesome, I should have used the regular ones because rhey stuck out to far from the window, they wouldn't fit right with my overlay wooden valances...so sizes I needed the regular curtain rods these were the 2inch and 3 inch...but I used them in other places, yes I would reccommend them in a heart beat

reviews.title: Great For Low Traffic Areas: Cheap Easy Install
reviews.review_text: I wound up getting a total of five sets due to their price and finding an awesome deal on curtains at a thrift shop prior to moving. It cost no more than $40 to decorate five windows, and I will be using curtains to separate the kitchen from the hallway too. You literally don't even have to use a drill (no anchors needed), as the screws will create perfect sized holes by just twisting them in with a Phillips screwdriver! FYI: For those who have playful kids, big playful puppies or boisterous adults, you may want to pay more for more sturdy curtain rods. These are a little flimsy and might as well have the same hold as Velcro. That's all I needed, but for faster-paced households with more traffic, get you some solid metal rods that cost at least $10.00 each, purchase anchors on the side if not included, and plan on using a drill. These are metal, but if the curtain is stepped on, this will bend this material and pull the rod out of place. Hope this helps!

reviews.title: VERY FLIMSY
reviews.review_text: Dont bother getting these unless you never plan on touxhing your curtains! hung them up, tried moving the curtain the smallest amount and the rods BENT. These curtains are very light, too. vetter to just spend a little more for higher quality. with these youre throwing your money right in the trash.

reviews.title: Brackets missing
reviews.review_text: This item did not come with any hardware to install. Package was apparently returned by a previous customer and your employees just put it back on the shelf without realizing parts were missing. What a waste of my time to have to return an item I ordered for pickup. Now, I have to go inside the store for the return.

reviews.title: hardware
reviews.review_text: would appreciate screws for hardware not nails. used the nails before and they pulled out when we hung insulated curtains on them

This was exactly what we needed to hang a curtain over the window on the door in our kitchen. It was easy to install, sturdy, and handled our heavier blackout curtain with ease.
The plastic piece for sliding on the curtain must be removed before connecting the rod complete. Plus, you must use care handling to keep it from bending.
Rod were bent .I have no idea how the person delivering these items managed to bend items the way they did!

Product itself was great, but I ordered a multi pack, and it was unavailable so they substituted a bunch of singles which was fine, except for one of them was a double pack, which was not what we needed and left us with a few brackets short.

reviews.title: Great price
reviews.review_text: I used this on a 72 inch window. it worked very well. The center support for a wide window works well. You wouldn't be able to use heavy drapery with this rod, but for lightweight curtains, it's great.
It's your basic really cheap curtain rod. It does the job but doesn't withstand being pulled on very good. The screws strip and breaks real easy during installation so just be careful .
You literally can not use these. They bend with the slightest weight and are useless. I really do not know why they sell them. Jesus, I can make my own, these are so weak.

reviews.title: Nice cheap curtain rods
reviews.review_text: Thank goodness I ordered the 6 pack of curtain rods! I was only putting up 2 of them but I went thru 5 of them for extra screws. You need to put in extra screws! They're kind of small %26 very easy to drop. Apparently there is a black hole in my house because I never did find the screws I dropped.

reviews.title: parts missing
reviews.review_text: I app ordered this item for curbside pickup because I forget the measurements while in the store. I went to hang these today only to find both packages with holes in them and the mounting brackets and handware missing. I've started a refund but I'm not happy to have this project delayed until I can find an unopened package.

reviews.title: Sometimes the Old Way is the Best Way
reviews.review_text: I installed replacement blinds in my kitchen... thanks to the affordability and easy installation of blinds offered by Walmart. I wasn't satisfied with the privacy of just the blinds. I wanted curtains, too. The solution was an old-fashioned curtain rod. They're made to work with blinds or sheers. They don't impact the blinds but allow for nice, freely flowing curtains to add color, elegance, and additional privacy.

reviews.title: It's like $2 ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
reviews.review_text: Very lightweight - good for not adding extra weight to wall, bad for hanging particularly heavy curtains. Curves all the way around, easy to achieve black-out (just need to add light blockers above). The thin metal brackets it comes with are easy to accidentally snap (rendering it useless) so be careful. Ideal for sheers or valances as it is very thin and easy to install over kitchen windows or whatnot. As long as you keep those things in mind, the pricing makes it all easily justifiable purchase. Ornate curtain rods are beautiful, these are obviously ugly but they're going to be COMPLETELY hidden when curtains are closed so it's worth it. If you plan on having curtains open sometimes, maybe just add a thin valance between the curtains that can easily be squished out of the way when trying to close curtains, but extends open to cover ugly rod when wanting open curtains.

reviews.title: Lucky to buy them clearance price
reviews.review_text: These curtain rods where exactly what I needed for my extra bedroom. I also ordered the blue and white sheers that I'm hanging up from Walmart. I order everything online and I am so glad that the young man was able to find these since they were on clearance.

reviews.title: Not for mid - heavy drapes.
reviews.review_text: The rod is good if you just need something to hang a light weight curtain/drape. If your drapes have some weight to them you might invest in another rod that is not as thin/flexable. The middle support bracket that is included is NOT really long enough to provide ample support. I had separately purchased extra long support for mine.

reviews.title: Center supports are too short
reviews.review_text: The rods are great - your basic metal expandable rods. They mounted easily and provided the extra clearance needed. However, the center supports are too short to use with the 3” clearance rods and they are definitely needed on a 60” wide window. We are trying to come up with an alternative but that should not be necessary.

reviews.title: What are you waiting for? The price is right?
reviews.review_text: Can’t beat the price two dollars really and I’m 64 years old and installed it myself that’s how easy it was. My living room looks fantastic with new curtains up. I can’t believe what a difference over two dollars kept me from putting curtains up but if I had known that I. Would have done it so much sooner!

reviews.title: It's a curtain rod!
reviews.review_text: I mean, it's a curtain rod. It came with the correct hooks to attach it to the wall. It's as good of quality as any other curtain rod of this style that I've even bought. I ordered online, it was described as such I knew what to expect. It did however come in a huuuuge box which was a little ridiculous- but we are moving so the box will be handy.

reviews.title: Needs Reinforcement
reviews.review_text: Because it's so long, it's not very sturdy, the clamp doesn't do anything to help. We used a hook to add some stability to the middle of the rod, and it worked well. Other than that they are def worth it if it's what you can afford, they do what they need to do.

reviews.title: Flimsy and no center support
reviews.review_text: It is incredibly flimsy - I know it's cheap but I still expected more. As others noted, the screws it comes with are very short, I dont think they even go all the way through the drywall to the stud. The rod itself is not held on by any screws, it can fall down pretty easily and I havent even put up a curtain yet. A hook is provided to support the center but it is too short so it doesn't reach the 3 inches out to where the curtain rod is - useless. Id have to go to the hardware store to buy a longer hook. I bought it to use with blackout curtains and I don't think it will support their weight. If you want a cheap solution for light curtains you might be OK with this product. Otherwise, spend a bit more for a normal curtain rod. It's been a waste of my install time, a few bucks, and a few extra holes in my wall.

reviews.review_text: I ordered the wrong size by accident but will keep these because I'm sure I'll find a use for them in the future. Such a good basic design you can't go wrong and a very inexpensive way to make your windows look finished.

Exactly what I wanted. Nothing fancy but gets the job done, easy to hang and great price. Love the wrap around the corner to completely cover the window edges and have no light escape around the curtains.
